author: sproul
content:
yeah I think we are too late in the process to fix anything for mainnet, so plan of action should be:

- LH reverts to the old behaviour on v1 endpoint (I'm looking into how hard this is to do)
- We introduce v2 proposer duties for Glamsterdam and deprecate v1 at Glamsterdam

author: dgusakov
content: In our use case (historical performance calculation), proposer_lookahead is not a perfect fit

author: sproul
content: LH impl doesnâ€™t seem too bad, so weâ€™re on track

author: stefanbratanov
content: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests I see this repo has been archived, will there be an alternative to browsing the spec tests rather than having to unzip the tars from the consesus-specs release. I found it useful to quickly check any new test types that need to be implemented.

author: manunlp
content: We have found a slight issue in Prysm VC

author: kalo9480
content:
We have found the [same issue](https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/598292067260825641/1433168179953274993) with Nimbus VC as with Prysm VC.
I cannot yet confirm it holds for `/eth/v2/validator/aggregate_and_proofs`, but it does for `/eth/v2/beacon/pool/attestations`.

author: kalo9480
content:
I've opened an [issue](https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/issues/7680) on Nimbus' github.
We are on `multiarch-v25.9.2` if it matters.

author: jtraglia
content: Hey consensus devs, we just published the [v1.6.0-beta.2](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/releases/tag/v1.6.0-beta.2) release! It includes no changes to Fulu. This release is mostly focussed around improving the Gloas specifications & testing. To be clear, it does not set the upgrade schedule for Fulu as discussed at ACDC today. Please take a moment to review the [Set fork epoch & blob schedule for Fulu](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4689) PR. We are planning to make the stable v1.6.0 release as soon as it's merged ðŸ™‚

author: jtraglia
content: Heads up. There was a mistake (my fault) in the tests for this release; there are many missing tests. I'm going to regenerate the reference tests with the fix & update the release assets. Sorry about this. Should be fixed within 2 hours.
